result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chad Edington

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Chad Michael Edington in court.  Attorney Lauren Stuckert in court for Chad Michael Edington.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for status conference. Defense requested plea and sentencing date early next year. State does not object. Court granted defense's request. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 36; all conditions of bail remain. Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Chad Edington in court with attorney Lauren Stuckert.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for an arraignment.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  State informs the court that discovery and an offer was sent to Defense.  Defense requests a status date to allow additional time for review.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 36, Rm 316 SB.  Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Chad Edington in court, appear by video with attorney Lauren Stuckert. appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 38.  All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 608 of the Courthouse. Defendant Chad Edington in court with attorney Lauren Stuckert.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests an arraignment date.  Arraignment scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered the $2500.00 cash bail to be returned to the remitter.
Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No driving without a valid license and state required insurance.
Court orders defendant TO JUSTICE POINT for Level 2 supervision. Defendant to report to JUSTICE POINT immediately upon leaving court.  IF THE DEFENDANT FAILS TO REPORT A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Chad Edington in court with attorney Lauren Stuckert.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 608 of the Courthouse.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Chad Edington
Current: 10125 W Sunset Ave, Wauwatosa, WI 53222   (Effective: 07-11-2022)
Prior: 2018 North 51st Street, Milwaukee, WI 53208

Attorney Lauren Stuckert in court.  Ann R. Lopez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.
Case is adjourned back to Out of Custody Court, Safety Builing Room 221.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 057388,
Payable Number: 1014772,

Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 7/1/22 @ 1p
